Sun of Faith - English: King Shuddhodana confered with his brothers and considered how to prevent by any means the Youth Siddharta from renouncing the world.
Manual - English: The city of Kapilavastu with seven concentric rings of moats and walls is heavily guarded.

Sun of Faith - English: “The city is fortified by seven walls and seven moats.
Inscription - English: The palace of Kapilavastu has seven layers of walls and seven moats.

Sun of Faith - English: Bar the doors with iron and hang loud bells so that if they open, the sound will carry for a league in the surrounding area.
Manual - English: Depict five hundred men closing the iron doors and loud bells.

Sun of Faith - English: At night five-hundred men must remove the portable ladder on the palace exterior, and in the morning five-hundred men must replace it.
Manual - English: Another five hundred men puts up a giant ladder and collects it. Soldiers guard within every wall. The Buddha's palace is guarded by the king's four brothers. There is the Buddha in the palace. In a room in the palace, many women play music instruments and make various offerings. Aniruddha is on watch outside the palace.

Sun of Faith - English: In his upper chambers, the Bodhisattva must be surrounded by the best women, who should distract him with song, dance, and music. Ministers together with four divisions of troops must keep watch outside the walls. At night King Shuddhodana and troops will guard the eastern gate. Shuklodana will guard the western gate. Dronadana will guard the southern gate. And Amritodana will guard the northern gate.
Inscription - English: The bodhisattva surrounded by his harem.

Sun of Faith - English: The person who would see to this at the center of it all was Shakya Mahanaman.
In the first watch of the night Shakya Mahanama went to the eastern gate and asked, "Who is keeping watch here?"
Mahanaman said,“Divine One, please keep watch. It will be good for you."
"The mundane sleeper is like a corpse. Demons overwhelm the sleeper. The sleepless are always vigilant. Do not sleep, keep watch!"

He then visited the the other locations, where the brothers were stationed, and exhorted them to keep watch. He did likewise during the other watches of the night. Then at dawn he said, "One night down, six to go."

So six full days passed. On the night of the seventh, Lord of the Gods Indra made an appeal. The Bodhisattva thought, "In the future non-believers and others might slander me, saying 'Why would you give up sixty-thousand women and renounce the world?'" So he made his best queen Yashodhara pregnant with a son. She knew she was pregnant, and thought to tell him the next day.
